programmes.show_description: An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Classic 80s comedy starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Danny DeVito. Can a 'perfect' human specimen and a pint-sized crook teach each other a thing or two on a wild quest to find their mother? (1988)
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Rumpole and Portia: Rumpole represents a scrap dealer accused of selling weapons to terrorists. But how will Rumpole fare when the case goes before a familiar figure?
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
That's Our Dad: Bill Cassidy is the TV dad of the hit series, 'That's Our Dad.' But when the cameras stop rolling he is an egotistical man who verbally abuses his co-stars and crew members.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Love At Second Sight: Jonathan and Mark meet Ted, an angel, on their way to the next assignment. Ted tries to sabotage Jonathan's mission, which involves finding his wife a new love interest.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Teleshopping.

We bring you the hottest destinations, ground-breaking ships and the latest deals to ensure your next cruise is your greatest one! Call 0800 090 3393 or visit us at www.loveitbookit.com/tv.
Blind Justice: Adam becomes a lawyer, but when a promised job falls through, he and Mary decide to return to Walnut Grove so that Adam can open his own law practice.
I Do, Again: Caroline seems to be having pregnancy symptoms. But she is soon disappointed to learn that instead of being pregnant, she is starting menopause.
The Lost Ones: Part 1: Charles and Albert go on a delivery run and meet up with the Cooper family. Whilst tackling a steep hill, Alvin loses control of his waggon. Part 1 of 2.
The Lost Ones: Part 2: Mr Tompkins takes in Cassandra and James so he can have help. The children are so unhappy they run away and decide they want to live with the Ingalls. Part 2 of 2.
The Reincarnation Of Nellie: Part 1: Nellie and Percival move to New York City to take over Percival's father's store. Part 1 of 2.
The Reincarnation Of Nellie: Part 2: Nancy tricks her brother Willie into locking a classroom rival in the ice shed so that she can play the lead role in an upcoming musical. Part 2 of 2.
Growing Pains: James begins feeling insecure about his place in the Ingalls family and tries a little too hard to emulate Albert.
Dark Sage: A young university-trained physician named Caleb LeDoux comes to Walnut Grove and, despite his skills, faces prejudice from everyone bar the Ingalls.
A Wiser Heart: Laura attends a writing seminar in Arizona, but the experience is marred by a rude professor who cuts her down at every opportunity.
Gambini The Great: Ageing circus daredevil Gambini the Great has a hypnotic effect on the children of Walnut Grove, especially Albert and Willie.
The Legend Of Black Jake: A pair of bumbling crooks kidnap Nels and hold him for ransom. However, Mrs Olesen refuses to pay the $100 fee required to free her husband.
Chicago: Charles travels to Chicago to comfort his grief-stricken friend, Mr Edwards, after young newspaper reporter John Jr dies in what appears to be a tragic streetcar accident.
For The Love Of Nancy: A young boy is mercilessly teased at school for being overweight. However, Nancy decides to go easy on him - but does she have an ulterior motive to be nice?
Secret House of Death: Chilling murder mystery with Amanda Redman and Owen Teale. Everybody needs good neighbours. Unfortunately, Susan's are about to embroil her in a crime of passion.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Secret House of Death: Chilling murder mystery with Amanda Redman and Owen Teale. Everybody needs good neighbours. Unfortunately, Susan's are about to embroil her in a crime of passion.
Comic capers with Sid James, Diana Coupland, Terry Scott and June Whitfield. The Abbots have new neighbours - but will they get on like a house on fire or will fence lines become battle lines? (1972)
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Comic capers with Sid James, Diana Coupland, Terry Scott and June Whitfield. The Abbots have new neighbours - but will they get on like a house on fire or will fence lines become battle lines? (1972)
Human Interest: Henry and Matthew find themselves needing to find a new housekeeper when Enid wins money on the premium bonds. Will they be able to agree on a suitable replacement?
Success Story: Matthew is delighted when Henry's successful younger brother Edward comes to stay. But will Henry be proud or envious of his sibling's achievements?
Rumpole and the Barrow Boy: Rumpole agrees to defend Nigel Timson when his insider trading case comes to trial. Elsewhere, Hilda becomes increasingly frustrated by Rumpole's lack of ambition.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Love And Marriage: Part 1: Jonathan and Mark take a couple back in time to help them understand what life would have been like had they not met each other 49 years earlier.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Love And Marriage: Part 2: Mark gives his friend a lesson about marriage that he hopes she will hold dear to her before marrying her fianc√© Brad.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.

High Spirits: Cynical about Matthew and Fiona's belief in ghosts, Henry accepts the challenge to stay in a haunted, abandoned railway station overnight.
The Caretakers: Grandpa gets angry and moves out with Grandma after John suggests he take life a little easier.
The Shivaree: Olivia plans a wedding for a friend's daughter, but the city-bred financier objects to the proceedings, not really understanding the customs of the people of Walton's Mountain.
The Choice: John considers Jason's desire to study music a waste of time. Jason, however, is intent on following his dreams and tries to win a scholarship to the Klineberg Conservatory.
The Statue: Grandpa is the lucky winner of a raffle from Ike Godsey's store; however, Grandma's feelings are hurt when she sees the prize.
The Song: Ben's plan to win a girl's heart sends her into the arms of Jason.
The Woman: John and Olivia are preparing to celebrate their 20th wedding anniversary, and John-Boy begins to make plans with an older woman, whom he falls in love with.
The Venture: The family may lose its considerable investment in a new business when John is hospitalised with pneumonia.
The Sermon: When Walton Mountain's only schoolteacher and its minister suddenly decide to get married, John-Boy has to give the Sunday sermon.

Turbulent action comedy with Mel Gibson and Robert Downey Jr. Brace for impact in 1960s Laos as a renegade pilot's new job drops him straight into smuggling, schemes and a fight for survival... (1990)
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.

Turbulent action comedy with Mel Gibson and Robert Downey Jr. Brace for impact in 1960s Laos as a renegade pilot's new job drops him straight into smuggling, schemes and a fight for survival... (1990)
U.N. the Night and the Music: Three UN delegates visit the camp and make a lasting impression. BJ has no time for visitors when his patient must lose his leg after gangrene sets in.
Strange Bedfellows: Charles' snoring is keeping Hawkeye and BJ awake at night but he refuses to discuss any suggestions. Colonel Potter discovers that his son-in-law has had an affair.
